translations.literal: Sun Tzu Wu was a man from Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Sun Tzu Wu was a man from Qi.

translations.literal: He presented himself to King Helü of Wu with his military strategies.
translations.idiomatic: He presented his military strategies to King Helü of Wu.

translations.literal: Helü said: 'I have completely read your thirteen chapters. Could you conduct a small test of drilling troops?'
translations.idiomatic: Helü said: 'I have completely read your thirteen chapters. Could you conduct a small test of drilling troops?'

context.next: 對曰：「可。」

translations.chinese: 對曰：「可。」
translations.literal: He replied: 'Acceptable.'

translations.chinese: 闔廬曰：「可試以婦人乎？」
translations.literal: Helü said: 'Could you test with women?'
translations.idiomatic: Helü said: 'Could you test with women?'

context.previous: 對曰：「可。」

context.previous: 闔廬曰：「可試以婦人乎？」

translations.literal: So he was permitted to do so. Palace ladies were selected, one hundred and eighty of them.
translations.idiomatic: So he was permitted to do so. One hundred eighty palace ladies were selected.

translations.idiomatic: Sun Tzu divided the women into two teams, appointing the king's two favorite consorts as captains of each team, and ordered all of them to carry halberds.

translations.literal: He commanded them saying: 'Do you know your heart and your left right hand back?'
translations.idiomatic: He commanded them, saying: 'Do you know your heart and your left and right hand and back?'

translations.literal: The women said: 'We know them.'

translations.idiomatic: Sun Tzu said: 'When marching forward, look at the heart;

context.next: 婦人曰：「諾。」

translations.chinese: 婦人曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Once the rules were laid out, he set up the axe and halberd, and repeated the commands three times and explained them five times.

context.previous: 婦人曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Then he drummed to the right, and the women burst out laughing.

translations.literal: Sun Tzu said: 'The rules are unclear, the commands are not familiar—the general's fault.'

translations.literal: He repeated the commands three times and explained them five times, then drummed to the left, and the women again burst out laughing.

context.previous: 孫子曰：「約束不明，申令不熟，將之罪也。」

translations.literal: once they are clear but not followed, it is the officers and soldiers' fault.'

context.previous: 孫子曰：「約束不明，申令不熟，將之罪也；
context.next: 乃欲斬左右隊長。

translations.literal: He was about to execute the team leaders on left and right.

translations.chinese: 吳王從臺上觀，見且斬愛姬，大駭。
translations.literal: King Wu watched from the terrace above, and seeing that his beloved consorts were about to be executed, he was greatly alarmed.

context.previous: 乃欲斬左右隊長。

translations.chinese: 趣使使下令曰：「寡人已知將軍能用兵矣。
translations.literal: He hurriedly sent a messenger down with orders: 'I already know the general can use troops.

context.previous: 吳王從臺上觀，見且斬愛姬，大駭。

translations.chinese: 寡人非此二姬，食不甘味，願勿斬也。」
translations.literal: Without these two consorts, my food has no flavor. Please do not execute them.'

context.previous: 趣使使下令曰：「寡人已知將軍能用兵矣。
context.next: 孫子曰：「臣既已受命為將，將在軍，君命有所不受。」

translations.chinese: 孫子曰：「臣既已受命為將，將在軍，君命有所不受。」
translations.literal: Sun Tzu said: 'I have already received the command to be general; when in the army, the general does not accept the sovereign's orders.'

context.previous: 寡人非此二姬，食不甘味，願勿斬也。」
context.next: 遂斬隊長二人以徇。

translations.chinese: 遂斬隊長二人以徇。
translations.literal: He executed the two team leaders as an example.

context.previous: 孫子曰：「臣既已受命為將，將在軍，君命有所不受。」
context.next: 用其次為隊長，於是復鼓之。

translations.literal: He appointed their seconds as team leaders, then drummed again.

context.previous: 遂斬隊長二人以徇。
context.next: 婦人左右前後跪起皆中規矩繩墨，無敢出聲。

translations.chinese: 婦人左右前後跪起皆中規矩繩墨，無敢出聲。
translations.literal: The women moved left right forward back, kneeling and standing—all conformed to the rules and regulations, none dared make a sound.

context.previous: 用其次為隊長，於是復鼓之。
context.next: 於是孫子使使報王曰：「兵既整齊，王可試下觀之，唯王所欲用之，雖赴水火猶可也。」

translations.chinese: 於是孫子使使報王曰：「兵既整齊，王可試下觀之，唯王所欲用之，雖赴水火猶可也。」
translations.literal: Then Sun Tzu sent a messenger to report to the king: 'The troops are now well-ordered. Your Majesty can come down to observe them. Whatever you wish to use them for, even if it means charging into water or fire, they will do it.'

context.previous: 婦人左右前後跪起皆中規矩繩墨，無敢出聲。
context.next: 吳王曰：「將軍罷休就舍，寡人不願下觀。」

translations.chinese: 吳王曰：「將軍罷休就舍，寡人不願下觀。」
translations.literal: King Wu said: 'General, please retire to your quarters. I do not wish to come down and observe.'

context.previous: 於是孫子使使報王曰：「兵既整齊，王可試下觀之，唯王所欲用之，雖赴水火猶可也。」
context.next: 孫子曰：「王徒好其言，不能用其實。」

translations.chinese: 孫子曰：「王徒好其言，不能用其實。」
translations.literal: Sun Tzu said: 'The king only likes the words but cannot use the reality.'

context.previous: 吳王曰：「將軍罷休就舍，寡人不願下觀。」
context.next: 於是闔廬知孫子能用兵，卒以為將。

translations.chinese: 於是闔廬知孫子能用兵，卒以為將。
translations.literal: Thus Helü knew Sun Tzu could use troops and finally appointed him as general.

context.previous: 孫子曰：「王徒好其言，不能用其實。」
context.next: 西破彊楚，入郢，北威齊晉，顯名諸侯，孫子與有力焉。

translations.chinese: 西破彊楚，入郢，北威齊晉，顯名諸侯，孫子與有力焉。
translations.literal: He broke the strong state of Chu in the west, entered Ying, awed Qi and Jin in the north, made his name illustrious among the feudal lords—Sun Tzu had a role in this.

context.previous: 於是闔廬知孫子能用兵，卒以為將。

translations.chinese: 孫武既死，後百餘歲有孫臏。
translations.literal: After Sun Wu died, more than a century later there was Sun Bin.

context.next: 臏生阿鄄之閒，臏亦孫武之後世子孫也。

translations.chinese: 臏生阿鄄之閒，臏亦孫武之後世子孫也。
translations.literal: Bin was born between Ao and Juan. Bin was also a descendant of Sun Wu's lineage.

context.previous: 孫武既死，後百餘歲有孫臏。
context.next: 孫臏嘗與龐涓俱學兵法。

translations.chinese: 孫臏嘗與龐涓俱學兵法。
translations.literal: Sun Bin once studied military strategy together with Pang Juan.

context.previous: 臏生阿鄄之閒，臏亦孫武之後世子孫也。
context.next: 龐涓既事魏，得為惠王將軍，而自以為能不及孫臏，乃陰使召孫臏。

translations.chinese: 龐涓既事魏，得為惠王將軍，而自以為能不及孫臏，乃陰使召孫臏。
translations.literal: After Pang Juan served Wei, he became General to Marquis Hui, but felt his abilities did not match Sun Bin's, so he secretly summoned Sun Bin.

context.previous: 孫臏嘗與龐涓俱學兵法。
context.next: 臏至，龐涓恐其賢於己，疾之，則以法刑斷其兩足而黥之，欲隱勿見。

translations.chinese: 臏至，龐涓恐其賢於己，疾之，則以法刑斷其兩足而黥之，欲隱勿見。
translations.literal: When Bin arrived, Pang Juan feared he was more worthy than himself, disliked him, and had his feet cut off and tattooed him to hide him away and not let him be seen.

context.previous: 龐涓既事魏，得為惠王將軍，而自以為能不及孫臏，乃陰使召孫臏。

translations.chinese: 齊使者如梁，孫臏以刑徒陰見，說齊使。
translations.literal: A Qi envoy came to Liang, and Sun Bin, as a criminal laborer, secretly met with him and persuaded him.

context.next: 齊使以為奇，竊載與之齊。

translations.chinese: 齊使以為奇，竊載與之齊。
translations.literal: The Qi envoy considered him extraordinary and secretly carried him back to Qi.

context.previous: 齊使者如梁，孫臏以刑徒陰見，說齊使。
context.next: 齊將田忌善而客待之。

translations.chinese: 齊將田忌善而客待之。
translations.literal: The Qi general Tian Ji treated him well as a guest.

context.previous: 齊使以為奇，竊載與之齊。
context.next: 忌數與齊諸公子馳逐重射。

translations.chinese: 忌數與齊諸公子馳逐重射。
translations.literal: Ji often raced chariots with the Qi nobles and wagered heavily.

context.previous: 齊將田忌善而客待之。
context.next: 孫子見其馬足不甚相遠，馬有上、中、下、輩。

translations.chinese: 孫子見其馬足不甚相遠，馬有上、中、下、輩。
translations.literal: Sun Tzu saw that their horses' speeds were not far apart, with horses divided into upper, middle, lower, and lowest grades.

context.previous: 忌數與齊諸公子馳逐重射。
context.next: 於是孫子謂田忌曰：「君弟重射，臣能令君勝。」

translations.chinese: 於是孫子謂田忌曰：「君弟重射，臣能令君勝。」
translations.literal: So Sun Tzu said to Tian Ji: 'My lord wagers heavily in chariot races. I can make you win.'

context.previous: 孫子見其馬足不甚相遠，馬有上、中、下、輩。
context.next: 田忌信然之，與王及諸公子逐射千金。

translations.chinese: 田忌信然之，與王及諸公子逐射千金。
translations.literal: Tian Ji believed him and wagered a thousand jin with the king and nobles.

context.previous: 於是孫子謂田忌曰：「君弟重射，臣能令君勝。」
context.next: 及臨質，孫子曰：「今以君之下駟與彼上駟，取君上駟與彼中駟，取君中駟與彼下駟。」

translations.chinese: 及臨質，孫子曰：「今以君之下駟與彼上駟，取君上駟與彼中駟，取君中駟與彼下駟。」
translations.literal: When it came time for the race, Sun Tzu said: 'Now use your lowest chariot against their highest, your highest against their middle, your middle against their lowest.'

context.previous: 田忌信然之，與王及諸公子逐射千金。
context.next: 既馳三輩畢，而田忌一不勝而再勝，卒得王千金。

translations.chinese: 既馳三輩畢，而田忌一不勝而再勝，卒得王千金。
translations.literal: After the three rounds were complete, Tian Ji lost one round but won two, and ultimately won the king's thousand jin.

context.previous: 及臨質，孫子曰：「今以君之下駟與彼上駟，取君上駟與彼中駟，取君中駟與彼下駟。」
context.next: 於是忌進孫子於威王。

translations.chinese: 於是忌進孫子於威王。
translations.literal: So Ji recommended Sun Tzu to King Wei.

context.previous: 既馳三輩畢，而田忌一不勝而再勝，卒得王千金。
context.next: 威王問兵法，遂以為師。

translations.chinese: 威王問兵法，遂以為師。
translations.literal: King Wei asked about military strategy and appointed him as teacher.

context.previous: 於是忌進孫子於威王。

translations.chinese: 其後魏伐趙，趙急，請救於齊。
translations.literal: Afterward, Wei attacked Zhao, Zhao was in dire straits and requested aid from Qi.

context.next: 齊威王欲將孫臏，臏辭謝曰：「刑餘之人不可。」

translations.chinese: 齊威王欲將孫臏，臏辭謝曰：「刑餘之人不可。」
translations.literal: King Wei of Qi wanted to appoint Sun Bin as general, but Bin declined saying: 'A mutilated criminal cannot.'

context.previous: 其後魏伐趙，趙急，請救於齊。
context.next: 於是乃以田忌為將，而孫子為師，居輜車中，坐為計謀。

translations.literal: So they appointed Tian Ji as general and Sun Tzu as advisor, riding in the supply wagon, seated and making plans.

context.previous: 齊威王欲將孫臏，臏辭謝曰：「刑餘之人不可。」
context.next: 田忌欲引兵之趙，孫子曰：「夫解雜亂紛糾者不控棬，救鬬者不搏撠，批亢擣虛，形格勢禁，則自為解耳。

translations.chinese: 田忌欲引兵之趙，孫子曰：「夫解雜亂紛糾者不控棬，救鬬者不搏撠，批亢擣虛，形格勢禁，則自為解耳。
translations.literal: Tian Ji wanted to lead troops to Zhao, but Sun Tzu said: 'Those who unravel tangles do not grab the fist, those who save fighters do not strike the head—strike the flanks and attack where empty, block their momentum and restrict their position, and they will resolve themselves.

context.previous: 於是乃以田忌為將，而孫子為師，居輜車中，坐為計謀。
context.next: 今梁趙相攻，輕兵銳卒必竭於外，老弱罷於內。

translations.chinese: 今梁趙相攻，輕兵銳卒必竭於外，老弱罷於內。
translations.literal: Now Liang and Zhao are attacking each other, their light troops and elite soldiers must be exhausted outside, the old and weak weary inside.

context.previous: 田忌欲引兵之趙，孫子曰：「夫解雜亂紛糾者不控棬，救鬬者不搏撠，批亢擣虛，形格勢禁，則自為解耳。
context.next: 君不若引兵疾走大梁，據其街路，衝其方虛，彼必釋趙而自救。

translations.chinese: 君不若引兵疾走大梁，據其街路，衝其方虛，彼必釋趙而自救。
translations.literal: My lord should lead troops and swiftly march to Daliang, occupy their thoroughfares, strike their vulnerable points—they will surely abandon Zhao and come to their own rescue.

context.previous: 今梁趙相攻，輕兵銳卒必竭於外，老弱罷於內。
context.next: 是我一舉解趙之圍而收獘於魏也。」

translations.chinese: 是我一舉解趙之圍而收獘於魏也。」
translations.literal: This way we can lift Zhao's siege with one stroke and gain exhausted troops from Wei.'

context.previous: 君不若引兵疾走大梁，據其街路，衝其方虛，彼必釋趙而自救。
context.next: 田忌從之，魏果去邯鄲，與齊戰於桂陵，大破梁軍。

translations.chinese: 田忌從之，魏果去邯鄲，與齊戰於桂陵，大破梁軍。
translations.literal: Tian Ji followed this, and Wei indeed left Handan and fought Qi at Guiling, suffering a great defeat.

context.previous: 是我一舉解趙之圍而收獘於魏也。」

translations.chinese: 後十三歲，魏與趙攻韓，韓告急於齊。
translations.literal: Thirteen years later, Wei and Zhao attacked Han, Han urgently appealed to Qi.

context.next: 齊使田忌將而往，直走大梁。

translations.chinese: 齊使田忌將而往，直走大梁。
translations.literal: Qi sent Tian Ji as general to go, directly marching to Daliang.

context.previous: 後十三歲，魏與趙攻韓，韓告急於齊。
context.next: 魏將龐涓聞之，去韓而歸，齊軍既已過而西矣。

translations.chinese: 魏將龐涓聞之，去韓而歸，齊軍既已過而西矣。
translations.literal: Wei general Pang Juan heard of it, left Han and returned, but the Qi army had already passed and gone west.

context.previous: 齊使田忌將而往，直走大梁。
context.next: 孫子謂田忌曰：「彼三晉之兵素悍勇而輕齊，齊號為怯，善戰者因其勢而利導之。

translations.chinese: 孫子謂田忌曰：「彼三晉之兵素悍勇而輕齊，齊號為怯，善戰者因其勢而利導之。
translations.literal: Sun Tzu said to Tian Ji: 'The troops of the three Jin states are fierce and brave by nature and look down on Qi. Qi has a reputation for cowardice. Good warriors exploit their momentum and guide it advantageously.

translations.literal: Military strategy says: those who pursue advantage a hundred li lose their general, those who pursue advantage fifty li arrive with half their army.

context.previous: 孫子謂田忌曰：「彼三晉之兵素悍勇而輕齊，齊號為怯，善戰者因其勢而利導之。

translations.literal: Have the Qi army enter Wei territory and make ten thousand cooking fires, the next day five thousand, the day after three thousand.'

translations.literal: Pang Juan marched three days and was greatly pleased, saying: 'I knew the Qi army was cowardly. Entering our territory three days, more than half their soldiers have deserted.'

translations.literal: He abandoned his infantry and with his light elite doubled their march to pursue them.

translations.chinese: 孫子度其行，暮當至馬陵。
translations.literal: Sun Tzu calculated their march route—they should arrive at Malings by dusk.

context.next: 馬陵道陜，而旁多阻隘，可伏兵，乃斫大樹白而書之曰「龐涓死于此樹之下」。

translations.literal: The Malings road was narrow, with many obstacles and defiles on the sides, suitable for ambushing troops. They cut a large tree white and wrote on it: 'Pang Juan dies beneath this tree.'

translations.literal: Then they ordered the Qi army's best archers with ten thousand crossbows to lie in ambush along the road, setting a time: 'When you see fire at dusk, all fire together.'

context.previous: 馬陵道陜，而旁多阻隘，可伏兵，乃斫大樹白而書之曰「龐涓死于此樹之下」。
context.next: 龐涓果夜至斫木下，見白書，乃鉆火燭之。

translations.chinese: 龐涓果夜至斫木下，見白書，乃鉆火燭之。
translations.literal: Pang Juan indeed arrived at night beneath the cut tree, saw the white writing, and lit a torch to read it.

context.previous: 於是令齊軍善射者萬弩，夾道而伏，期曰「暮見火舉而俱發」。
context.next: 讀其書未畢，齊軍萬弩俱發，魏軍大亂相失。

translations.chinese: 讀其書未畢，齊軍萬弩俱發，魏軍大亂相失。
translations.literal: He had not finished reading the writing when the Qi army's ten thousand crossbows all fired, and the Wei army fell into great chaos and scattered.

context.previous: 龐涓果夜至斫木下，見白書，乃鉆火燭之。

translations.chinese: 龐涓自知智窮兵敗，乃自剄，曰：「遂成豎子之名！」
translations.literal: Pang Juan knew his wisdom was exhausted and his troops defeated, so he cut his own throat, saying: 'This fulfills the reputation of that boy!'

translations.literal: Qi took advantage of the victory to completely destroy their army, capturing Wei's crown prince Shen and returning.

context.previous: 龐涓自知智窮兵敗，乃自剄，曰：「遂成豎子之名！」
context.next: 孫臏以此名顯天下，世傳其兵法。

translations.literal: Sun Bin thereby became famous throughout the world, and his military strategy was transmitted through the ages.

translations.literal: Wu Qi was a man from Wei.

context.next: 嘗學於曾子，事魯君。

translations.chinese: 嘗學於曾子，事魯君。
translations.literal: He once studied under Zengzi and served the Lord of Lu.

translations.literal: When Qi attacked Lu, Lu wanted to appoint Wu Qi as general, but Wu Qi had taken a Qi woman as wife, so Lu suspected him.

translations.chinese: 吳起於是欲就名，遂殺其妻，以明不與齊也。
translations.literal: Wu Qi then wanted to establish his reputation, so he killed his wife to show he had no connection with Qi.

context.previous: 齊人攻魯，魯欲將吳起，吳起取齊女為妻，而魯疑之。
context.next: 魯卒以為將。

translations.literal: Lu finally appointed him as general.

context.previous: 吳起於是欲就名，遂殺其妻，以明不與齊也。
context.next: 將而攻齊，大破之。

translations.chinese: 將而攻齊，大破之。
translations.literal: As general he attacked Qi and greatly defeated them.

context.previous: 魯卒以為將。

translations.chinese: 魯人或惡吳起曰：「起之為人，猜忍人也。
translations.literal: Some Lu people spoke ill of Wu Qi saying: 'Qi is a suspicious and cruel person.

context.next: 其少時，家累千金，游仕不遂，遂破其家，鄉黨笑之，吳起殺其謗己者三十餘人，而東出衛郭門。

translations.chinese: 其少時，家累千金，游仕不遂，遂破其家，鄉黨笑之，吳起殺其謗己者三十餘人，而東出衛郭門。
translations.literal: In his youth, his family had accumulated a thousand jin. He sought office but did not succeed, so he squandered his family fortune. The villagers laughed at him. Wu Qi killed more than thirty of those who slandered him and left east through the Wei city gate.

context.previous: 魯人或惡吳起曰：「起之為人，猜忍人也。
context.next: 與其母訣，齧臂而盟曰：『起不為卿相，不復入衛。』

translations.chinese: 與其母訣，齧臂而盟曰：『起不為卿相，不復入衛。』
translations.literal: He bid farewell to his mother, bit his arm and swore: 'If I do not become prime minister, I will not return to Wei.'

context.previous: 其少時，家累千金，游仕不遂，遂破其家，鄉黨笑之，吳起殺其謗己者三十餘人，而東出衛郭門。
context.next: 遂事曾子。

translations.literal: So he served Zengzi.

translations.literal: After some time, his mother died, but Qi did not return.

translations.chinese: 曾子薄之，而與起絕。
translations.literal: Zengzi despised him and broke relations with him.

context.previous: 居頃之，其母死，起終不歸。
context.next: 起乃之魯，學兵法以事魯君。

translations.literal: Qi then went to Lu and studied military strategy to serve the Lord of Lu.

translations.literal: The Lord of Lu suspected him, so Qi killed his wife to seek the generalship.

context.previous: 起乃之魯，學兵法以事魯君。
context.next: 夫魯小國，而有戰勝之名，則諸侯圖魯矣。

translations.chinese: 夫魯小國，而有戰勝之名，則諸侯圖魯矣。
translations.literal: Lu is a small state, and if it has the name of victory in battle, the feudal lords will covet Lu.

context.previous: 魯君疑之，起殺妻以求將。

translations.literal: Moreover, Lu and Wei are brother states, yet the lord employs Qi, which means abandoning Wei.'

context.next: 魯君疑之，謝吳起。

translations.literal: The Lord of Lu suspected him and dismissed Wu Qi.

translations.literal: Wu Qi then heard that Marquis Wen of Wei was worthy and wanted to serve him.

context.next: 文侯問李克曰：「吳起何如人哉？」

translations.chinese: 文侯問李克曰：「吳起何如人哉？」
translations.literal: Marquis Wen asked Li Ke: 'What kind of person is Wu Qi?'

context.previous: 吳起於是聞魏文侯賢，欲事之。
context.next: 李克曰：「起貪而好色，然用兵司馬穰苴不能過也。」

translations.chinese: 李克曰：「起貪而好色，然用兵司馬穰苴不能過也。」
translations.literal: Li Ke said: 'Qi is greedy and fond of women, but in using troops, even Sima Rangju cannot surpass him.'

context.previous: 文侯問李克曰：「吳起何如人哉？」
context.next: 於是魏文候以為將，擊秦，拔五城。

translations.chinese: 於是魏文候以為將，擊秦，拔五城。
translations.literal: So Marquis Wen of Wei appointed him as general and attacked Qin, capturing five cities.

context.previous: 李克曰：「起貪而好色，然用兵司馬穰苴不能過也。」

translations.chinese: 起之為將，與士卒最下者同衣食。
translations.literal: When Qi was general, he shared clothing and food with the lowest soldiers.

context.next: 臥不設席，行不騎乘，親裹贏糧，與士卒分勞苦。

translations.chinese: 臥不設席，行不騎乘，親裹贏糧，與士卒分勞苦。
translations.literal: He did not lay out mats when sleeping, did not ride when marching, personally wrapped the provisions, sharing hardship with the soldiers.

context.previous: 起之為將，與士卒最下者同衣食。
context.next: 卒有病疽者，起為吮之。

translations.chinese: 卒有病疽者，起為吮之。
translations.literal: When a soldier had a festering sore, Qi sucked it for him.

context.previous: 臥不設席，行不騎乘，親裹贏糧，與士卒分勞苦。
context.next: 卒母聞而哭之。

translations.literal: The soldier's mother heard and wept for him.

translations.literal: Someone said: 'Your son is a soldier, and the general himself sucked his sore. Why do you weep?'

context.previous: 卒母聞而哭之。
context.next: 母曰：「非然也。

translations.chinese: 母曰：「非然也。
translations.literal: The mother said: 'It's not that.

context.previous: 人曰：「子卒也，而將軍自吮其疽，何哭為？」
context.next: 往年吳公吮其父，其父戰不旋踵，遂死於敵。

translations.chinese: 往年吳公吮其父，其父戰不旋踵，遂死於敵。
translations.literal: In previous years Lord Wu sucked my husband's sore, and my husband fought without turning back and died on the battlefield.

context.previous: 母曰：「非然也。
context.next: 吳公今又吮其子，妾不知其死所矣。

translations.chinese: 吳公今又吮其子，妾不知其死所矣。
translations.literal: Now Lord Wu sucks my son's sore again. I don't know where my son will die.'

context.previous: 往年吳公吮其父，其父戰不旋踵，遂死於敵。
context.next: 是以哭之。」

translations.chinese: 是以哭之。」
translations.literal: So she wept for him.'

context.previous: 吳公今又吮其子，妾不知其死所矣。

translations.chinese: 文侯以吳起善用兵，廉平，盡能得士心，乃以為西河守，以拒秦、韓。
translations.literal: Marquis Wen considered Wu Qi skilled in using troops, incorruptible and fair, able to completely win the soldiers' hearts, so he appointed him governor of Xhe to resist Qin and Han.

translations.chinese: 魏文侯既卒，起事其子武侯。
translations.literal: After Marquis Wen of Wei died, Qi served his son Marquis Wu.

context.next: 武侯浮西河而下，中流，顧而謂吳起曰：「美哉乎山河之固，此魏國之寶也！」

translations.chinese: 武侯浮西河而下，中流，顧而謂吳起曰：「美哉乎山河之固，此魏國之寶也！」
translations.literal: Marquis Wu floated down the Yellow River, and in midstream turned to say to Wu Qi: 'How beautiful are the mountain and river fortifications—this is Wei's treasure!'

context.previous: 魏文侯既卒，起事其子武侯。
context.next: 起對曰：「在德不在險。

translations.chinese: 起對曰：「在德不在險。
translations.literal: Qi replied: 'It depends on virtue, not on natural defenses.

context.previous: 武侯浮西河而下，中流，顧而謂吳起曰：「美哉乎山河之固，此魏國之寶也！」
context.next: 昔三苗氏左洞庭，右彭蠡，德義不修，禹滅之。

translations.chinese: 昔三苗氏左洞庭，右彭蠡，德義不修，禹滅之。
translations.literal: In ancient times the Three Miao tribes had Dongting on the left and Pengli on the right. They did not cultivate virtue and righteousness, so Yu destroyed them.

context.previous: 起對曰：「在德不在險。
context.next: 夏桀之居，左河濟，右泰華，伊闕在其南，羊腸在其北，修政不仁，湯放之。

translations.chinese: 夏桀之居，左河濟，右泰華，伊闕在其南，羊腸在其北，修政不仁，湯放之。
translations.literal: Xia Jie resided with the Yellow River on the left and Mount Tai on the right, Yique to the south and Yangchang to the north. He practiced unbenevolent government, so Tang exiled him.

context.previous: 昔三苗氏左洞庭，右彭蠡，德義不修，禹滅之。
context.next: 殷紂之國，左孟門，右太行，常山在其北，大河經其南，修政不德，武王殺之。

translations.literal: King Zhou of Yin had Mengmen on the left and Taihang on the right, Changshan to the north and the great river flowing south. He practiced unde virtuous government, so King Wu killed him.

context.previous: 夏桀之居，左河濟，右泰華，伊闕在其南，羊腸在其北，修政不仁，湯放之。
context.next: 由此觀之，在德不在險。

translations.chinese: 由此觀之，在德不在險。
translations.literal: From this we can see it depends on virtue, not on natural defenses.

context.previous: 殷紂之國，左孟門，右太行，常山在其北，大河經其南，修政不德，武王殺之。
context.next: 若君不修德，舟中之人盡為敵國也。」

translations.chinese: 若君不修德，舟中之人盡為敵國也。」
translations.literal: If my lord does not cultivate virtue, everyone in this boat will become the enemy state's people.'

context.previous: 由此觀之，在德不在險。
context.next: 武侯曰：「善。」

translations.chinese: 武侯曰：「善。」
translations.literal: Marquis Wu said: 'Excellent.'

context.previous: 若君不修德，舟中之人盡為敵國也。」

translations.chinese: （即封）吳起為西河守，甚有聲名。
translations.literal: He appointed Wu Qi as governor of Xhe, and he had great renown.

context.next: 魏置相，相田文。

translations.chinese: 魏置相，相田文。
translations.literal: Wei appointed a chancellor, Chancellor Tian Wen.

context.previous: （即封）吳起為西河守，甚有聲名。

translations.chinese: 吳起不悅，謂田文曰：「請與子論功，可乎？」
translations.literal: Wu Qi was displeased and said to Tian Wen: 'May I discuss merits with you?'

context.previous: 魏置相，相田文。
context.next: 田文曰：「可。」

translations.chinese: 田文曰：「可。」
translations.literal: Tian Wen said: 'Acceptable.'

context.previous: 吳起不悅，謂田文曰：「請與子論功，可乎？」
context.next: 起曰：「將三軍，使士卒樂死，敵國不敢謀，子孰與起？」

translations.chinese: 起曰：「將三軍，使士卒樂死，敵國不敢謀，子孰與起？」
translations.literal: Qi said: 'Commanding the three armies, making soldiers gladly die for you, enemy states not daring to plot—who compares to me?'

context.previous: 田文曰：「可。」
context.next: 文曰：「不如子。」

translations.chinese: 文曰：「不如子。」
translations.literal: Wen said: 'I do not match you.'

context.previous: 起曰：「將三軍，使士卒樂死，敵國不敢謀，子孰與起？」

translations.chinese: 起曰：「治百官，親萬民，實府庫，子孰與起？」
translations.literal: Qi said: 'Managing the hundred officials, being close to the ten thousand people, filling the treasuries—who compares to me?'

context.previous: 文曰：「不如子。」
context.next: 文曰：「不如子。」

translations.chinese: 文曰：「不如子。」
translations.literal: Wen said: 'I do not match you.'

context.previous: 起曰：「治百官，親萬民，實府庫，子孰與起？」
context.next: 起曰：「守西河而秦兵不敢東鄉，韓趙賓從，子孰與起？」

translations.literal: Qi said: 'Guarding Xhe so Qin troops dare not face east, making Han and Zhao submit as guests—who compares to me?'

context.previous: 文曰：「不如子。」
context.next: 文曰：「不如子。」

translations.chinese: 文曰：「不如子。」
